That means you installed fglrx.  sudo apt-get purge fglrx
What driver did it install?  fglrx ?
what is the output of lsmod | grep fglrx   ?
lsmod lists all the modules that are currently being used.  (linux calles drivers modules) so yes.
grep just filters the list to show only things with 'fglrx' in the name
lsmod lists them all.  lsmod | grep fglrx will show the rows that have fglrx in them.
After you remove the package (sudo apt-get purge fglrx) restart the machine
It doesn't stand for anything.  It's a great name on it's on I guess.  It filters the output of lsmod
You can grep anything though.  Like a file,  grep banana somefile.txt    will show all the lines of somefile.txt that contain 'banana'
